title:
Topological Charge Quadrupole Protected by Spin-Orbit U(1)
  Quasi-Symmetry in Antiferromagnet NdBiPt
authors:
Ao Zhang, Xiaobing Chen, Jiayu Li, Pengfei Liu, Yuntian Liu, Qihang
  Liu
abstract:
The interplay of symmetry and topology in crystal solids has given rise to
various elementary excitations as quasiparticles. Among these, those with
significant Berry-phase-related transport responses are of particular interest.
Here, we predict a new type of quasiparticle called topological charge
quadruple (TCQ), which is analogous to a charge quadrupole but consists of two
closely-packed pairs of Weyl points in momentum space, specifically in a
half-Heusler antiferromagnet NdBiPt. Interestingly, the TCQ is protected by the
spin-orbit $U(1)$ quasi-symmetry, rather than any exact crystallographic
symmetries. This quasi-symmetry restricts the energy splitting induced by
symmetry-lowering perturbations to a second-order effect. Furthermore, the
closely located Berry curvature sources and sinks in the TCQ lead to a large
Berry curvature dipole, resulting in a significant nonlinear Hall effect. Our
work opens an avenue for designing novel quasiparticles using quasi-symmetries
and developing materials with enhanced nonlinear responses.
